name: Asympix18
author: Exidelo
description:
Palette
 for Pixeljoint's 18 colour palette competition. This palette takes into
 consideration human vision and is balanced on top of it, making it 
"human-centric" as I like to call it. The aim is to make as balanced and
 versatile a palette as possible within the given limitations; with the 
key balancing feature being the elimination and inclusion of certain 
colours based on their importance to the human mind. The distribution of
 the colours is skewed in such a way that the red-yellow range of the 
spectrum receives the most attention, followed by blue and green. The 
reasoning behind this is that this colour range in particular is the 
most important to our mind (most obviously because it accounts for all 
parts of the human skin). The palette's light and dark colours are 
distributed in such a way that there are more light colours than dark 
ones, with the reasoning being that we place more importance on the 
lights rather than on the shadows of an object or scene. In addition, 
the brightness and darkness of the black and white colours has been 
slightly neutered, to allow for a smoother transitions overall. 
Ultimately this should prove to be a balanced and flexible 
palette.
